title: Dexter font id
content:
Hi,

does anyone know what font is used in the title and credits of the TV series Dexter ( [http://www.sho.com/site/dexter/home.do](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225223400/http:/www.sho.com/site/dexter/home.do "http://www.sho.com/site/dexter/home.do"))?

cheers,  
Mark
author: zeugma

comments.content: Soda Script by Emigre is the base
Here you go: [Soda Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225223400/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=120) by Zuzana Licko herself. Just adapt the »R« and you are there.
Thanks Renko! Any idea about the upright sans serif (e.g. "Sundays at 9pm")?

\> Hmm, try Alternate Gothic …

... or [Trade Gothic Bold Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225223400/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/trade-gothic/bold-condensed-no-20-63882/).
I'd like to pretend that the designers of the logo caught notice of Soda Script from my [little review](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225223400/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/stewf/376096084/).
It's not spot on. The font used in Dexter's Cap S has parallel vertical elements in it and the lower case g is not the traditional double looped one. I'd like to know the actual one though.

I reckon the blade-style curve in the top of the "T" is what appeals to me. It fits his boat, as well: "The Slice of Life".

Wynne Hunkler  
 [Wynnefields Creative](http://web.archive.org/web/20120225223400/http:/www.wynnefields.com/)  
Visual Communications
